alert.note: Alert for Essex; Franklin (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 12:04AM EST until February 19 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New York, including the following counties, Clinton, Essex and Franklin. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Depending on ice behavior, any release of the ice jam could result in sudden rises of water, leading to a rapid flooding situation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1204 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lake Placid, Essex, Moriah, Willsboro, Crown Point, Westport, Wilmington, Elizabethtown, Keene, Minerva, Newcomb, Keene Valley, Mount Marcy, Jay In Essex County, Au Sable Forks, Port Henry, Schroon Lake, Crown Point Center, Keeseville and Port Kent. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
